page.title: 11ENERGY
page.content: A pipeline to transport gas from the gasfield under Morecambe Bay to the National Gas Grid near Kendal (to the east) crosses part of the study area. The pipeline comes ashore at the Rampside Gas Terminal about one mile to the south-west of the study area and passes to the west of the villages of Leece and Dendron. The pipeline cannot be seen as it has been buried underground.Tracing its route is getting difficult as fields are used again for grazing and as walls and fences are rebuilt and start to weather.Re-surfacing of sections of the lanes and small gas signs by the roadside will be the only reminder that the pipeline is there.However local people are not supplied with natural gas in their homes.
